intro: Astragalus cadmicus, commonly known as the cadmium milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several narrow leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Astragalus cadmicus is part of the legume family, Fabaceae, and has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria.
